Jamus loves branding & identity. all projects.
  • Contact

Jonathan Children’s Trust is a nonprofit organization in Zimbabwe which aims to restore human dignity to orphans and vulnerable children through education, love, and provision of daily human needs.

The symbol created for this identity is a representation of a sun composed of a heart to represent love, which JCT centers on. The radial arrows represents the love reaching outward creating new opportunities that would otherwise not exist for those limited by poverty.

Photography and Video: Rudo Mudzi.

Jamus is a graphic/motion designer +. He holds a BFA in graphic design from the School of Visual Arts.

Jamus is available for freelance work, collaborations, full-time hire.

Awards and Recognition

  • Works published in Typography 32
  • Works published in The Language of Graphic Design: An Illustrated Handbook for Understanding Fundamental Design Principles, by Richard Poulin
  • TDC56 Winner
  • Published in Typography 31
  • Works preserved in the AIGA Design Archives
  • Selected for Publication in CMYK Magazine’s Call For Aspiring Creatives #43

  • The Boyzzz Scholarship Award—Motion Graphics Achievement Award, SVA
  • Works published in Visual Literacy: A Conceptual Approach to Graphic Problem Solving, by Richard Wilde
